ethnologue_comment.comment:
E16/E17/E18/E19/E20/E21/E22/E23/E24/E25/E26 has an entry Laopang [lbg] as an unclassified Loloish/Ngwi language of Myanmar (E16/E17/E18/E19/E20/E21/E22/E23/E24/E25/E26)/Laos (E16/E17/E18/E19/E20/E21/E22/E23/E24/E25/E26) with the alternate name Laopa. There appears to be only one language in the literature that can match these characteristics, namely Xa-Pho of
**hh:he:Abadie:Haut-Tonkin**:185-186 who testifies they call themselves Lao-pa. However, this language already has an entry in E16/E17/E18/E19/E20/E21/E22/E23/E24/E25/E26 as Laghuu [lgh] (cf.~**hh:phon:EdmondsonZiwo:Laghuu**). See also: Laghuu [lgh].
